page.title: 18DRAINING THE FENS
page.content: In{Fendrayton}is an old{Dutch}home. It was built in{1715}for workers {draining the fens.}It has a sign saying '{1715 Niet zonder hrbyt}'which means{'Nothing gained without labour}' In 1712 England began thinking about draining the fens.The Duke of Bedford put in a lot of money. Then the eager Dutch came over to drain them. They wanted the money and the fertile soil which was very good for growing crops. There were also some{Scottish {prisoners}who were forced to help. The{fen men}were very angry and worried that they would lose the sort of life that they had lived.They would lose their houses and would not be free anymore.They would have to work for other people.There was a lot of terror and deaths but finally the Dutch managed to{drain the fens.
